Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
HumanPlayer, RandomPlayer
abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
Provides a command line user interface to prompt current Player to enter cell coordinates, add corresponding mark to Board object, checks winning status, and pass the turn to opponents.
Since:
Oct 19, 2020
Version:
2.0
Author:
Scott Tianhan Jiang

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    protected abstract void makeMove()
    An abstract method that is to be implemented by its subclasses.
    protected void play()
    Calls makeMove() method to get user input cell coordinates, check winning status and pass turn to the opponent of current Player object.
    protected void setBoard​(Board theBoard)
    Sets the argument Board object to the board attribute of current object.
    protected void setOpponent​(Player opponent)
    Sets the argument Player object as the opponent attribute of current Player object.

      protected void play() throws java.io.IOException
      Calls makeMove() method to get user input cell coordinates, check winning status and pass turn to the opponent of current Player object.

      java.io.IOException - from makeMove() method.

    • makeMove

      protected abstract void makeMove() throws java.io.IOException
      An abstract method that is to be implemented by its subclasses.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - since this method uses BufferReader
